description: Learn how to embed multimedia content like images, audio, and video into your web pages.

slides.title: Introduction to Media
slides.content:
# Multimedia on the Web üé¨

Multimedia comes in many different formats. It can be almost anything you can hear or see:

- Images
- Music
- Sound
- Videos
- Animations

HTML has dedicated tags for these media types.

slides.title: Images
slides.content: # The Tag üñºÔ∏è As learned in Basics, `` embeds an image. ## Important Attributes - `src`: Path to the image. - `alt`: Alternate text (crucial for accessibility). - `loading`: "lazy" (defers loading until scrolling near). ```html ``` ## Responsive Images Use `style="max-width:100%;height:auto;"` to allow images to scale with the screen. ```html ```

slides.title: Video
slides.content:
# The <video> Element üé•

Embed video files (MP4, WebM, Ogg).

```html
<video width="320" height="240" controls poster="thumbnail.jpg">
  <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
```

- `controls`: Play/pause buttons.
- `poster`: An image shown before playing.
- `muted`: Starts the video muted (often required for autoplay).
- `loop`: Loops the video.

slides.title: Audio
slides.content:
# The <audio> Element üéµ

Embed sound files (MP3, WAV, Ogg).

```html
<audio controls app-autoplay>
  <source src="horse.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
  <source src="horse.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>
```

Works similarly to `<video>`, but without visual dimensions.

slides.title: Embedding Youtube
slides.content:
# Embedding YouTube üì∫

The easiest way to play videos is to use YouTube.

Use an `<iframe>` (Inline Frame) to embed external content.

```html
<iframe width="420" height="315"
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tgbNymZ7vqY">
</iframe>
```

- `width` and `height` define size.
- `src` points to the video URL.

> üí° **Youtube Tip:** You can add parameters like `?autoplay=1` or `?mute=1` to the URL.

slides.title: IFrames
slides.content:
# The <iframe> Tag üñºÔ∏è

An IFrame displays a web page within a web page.

```html
<iframe src="https://www.w3schools.com" title="W3Schools Free Online Web Tutorials">
</iframe>
```

It's often used for maps (Google Maps), videos, or third-party widgets.

To remove the border:
```html
<iframe src="demo.html" style="border:none;"></iframe>
```

slides.title: SVG Images
slides.content:
# SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) ‚úèÔ∏è

SVGs are defined in XML and can be embedded directly into HTML.

```html
<svg width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />
</svg>
```

Advantages:
- Scalable without quality loss.
- Small file size.
- Programmable with CSS and JS.

slides.title: Favicons
slides.content:
# Favicons üîñ

A favicon is a small image displayed next to the page title in the browser tab.

It is defined in the `<head>` section:

```html
<link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="/images/favicon.ico">
```

Common formats: .ico, .png, .svg.
